Sentencas: A novel micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) design with an inert support was proposed for operation on direct hydrocarbon fuels with an improved stability.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: In this design, the inert support also serves as a diffusion barrier between the fuel stream and Ni cermet anode.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: The barrier effect leads to higher local steam to carbon ratios in the anode, thus inhibiting carbon deposition.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: To demonstrate this concept, we fabricated micro-tubular SOFCs with a porous yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) support.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: Ni, Ni-scandia-stabilized zirconia (ScSZ), ScSZ, strontium-doped lanthanum manganite (LSM)-ScSZ, and LSM were used as the anode current collector, anode, electrolyte, cathode, and cathode current collector, respectively.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: Good electrochemical performance was achieved with hydrogen and methane fuels in a temperature range 600-750 A degrees C. Continuous cell operation on direct methane fuel for > 40 h at 750
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: A degrees C under moderate current densities delivered stable voltage without any evident performance degradation due to carbon deposition.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: The absence of carbon deposition on the anode and anode current collector layers was also confirmed by scanning electron microscope images and energy-dispersive X-ray spectra.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support

Sentencas: We further discuss oxidation mechanism of the direct methane fuel and removal of the carbon possibly formed in the anodic layers during stability testing.
Titulo: Direct methane operation of a micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with a porous zirconia support
